p: Although a targeted search for pathogens able to produce an epidemic/pandemic of acute respiratory infections started in the late 19th century (Pfeiffer 1893; Olitsky and Gates 1921a, b), it was not until 1933 that the influenza A virus was selected (myxovirus influenza) (Smith, Andrewes and Laidlaw 1933). Influenza B and C viruses were identified in 1940 and 1947, respectively (Francis 1940; Taylor 1949), and the influenza D virus was isolated and characterized recently in 2011 (Hause et al. 2013; Ducatez, Pelletier and Meyer 2015).
